name: Work Student in Software Engineering
whoWeAre: TonkaIn is on a mission to enable more medical professionals to use ultrasound to improve patient care.  We have developed a wireless, smartphone ultrasound scanner that is disrupting a $6 billion medical imaging business.  We are always searching for innovative, self-starters to join our team. We have an opening for a Senior Project Manager. This position will work with the R&D and Operations teams to develop PMO level Project Management processes and capabilities for the company. Projects will be tailored towards the conceptual development, detailed design, verification and validation of ultrasound medical devices. Essential abilities of the successful candidates include New Product Introduction, traditional and agile project management in a hardware/software environment.
responsibilities: Develop PMO level project management processes and tools to ensure projects run efficiently and consistently across the company
Lead integration of project management processes into the QMS
Lead project portfolio summarization for cost, schedule and resource management
Lead project planning (traditional and agile) sessions
Coach other project management staff on best practices
Develop and lead scope definition & change management processes for project definition
Develop and lead project risk management
education: B.Sc. in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering, Management of Technology, or equivalent
knowledge: Advanced knowledge of the principles, theories, concepts and practices of project management.
Advanced interpersonal skills to build and maintain relationships with multiple internal and external stakeholders.
Advanced analytical thinking and problem solving skills, to resolve critical and high impact issues.
Advanced financial acumen to allow for effective planning, management, and expenditure of operational and capital costs.
Evidence of Cost, Schedule and Scope management for complex capital, product development (preference to combined hardware/software system products)
A strong drive to succeed with a track record of being highly productive
Ability to deal with changing priorities and requirements
experience: >7 years experience in project management (required), including planning and budgeting
>7 years experience in team management, preferably within an embedded system environment (hardware & software)
>5 years of experience managing projects in a highly regulated industry
Medical device experience is a plus
Startup experience is a plus
Development of PMO level project management processes that comply with PMI is required
ISO13485 & ISO 14971 familiarity (or other highly regulated industry)
Leading NPI projects in partnership with customers
Work authorization for Canada
whatWeOffer: Competitive base salary (commensurate with experience and education)
Opportunities for career advancement within the company
An opportunity to help create a paradigm shift in the medical field
deathLines: Please send a cover letter and resume to careers@clarius.com by May 18, 2018. We thank all applicants for their interest; only those are selected for interviews will be contacted.

whoWeAre: TonkaIn is on a mission to enable more medical professionals to use ultrasound to improve patient care.  We have developed a wireless, smartphone ultrasound scanner that is disrupting a $6 billion medical imaging business.  We are always searching for innovative, self-starters to join our team. We have an opening for a Quality Engineer. This position will assist the Quality team with the implementation and maintenance of QMS for medical devices, specifically FDA 21 CFR Part 820, MDSAP and ISO13485. Work with the Engineering team and suppliers to assure compliance to applicable Clarius specifications and Medical Device Regulations. This position will also be responsible for general quality engineering activities related to the continuous improvement of our operations both internally and externally to reduce the impact of product non-conformances overall.
responsibilities: Work with the QA team, Purchasing, Manufacturing Engineering, Research & Development, Customer Support, and external suppliers to ensure product and material performance is adequately monitored and where problems occur, appropriate and timely root cause analysis and corrective actions are implemented as required.
Develop inspection documents for First Article Inspection, incoming parts/materials, product in process, and outgoing product.

Disposition and trend of non-conforming parts and product. Champion problem solving and root cause analysis activities with internal and external suppliers and customers to eliminate recurrence of non‐conformances.
Monitor, communicate, and improve key supplier performance criteria such as KPI’s and CTQ’s, including Supplier OTD (Past due), DPPM and scrap. Including supporting supplier’s SCAR management.
Address in-process quality issues in a timely manner to ensure continuity of production and supply. Engage QA, Purchasing, Production, R&D, and as required.
Develop and lead scope definition & change management processes for project definition
Develop and lead project risk management
